Play an exhibition to get some quick soccer action, or face the challenges of a tournament, where losing will end your run at the championship. Thanks to context-sensitive commentary, you'll swear that you are watching a live game. FIFA SOCCER '96 has all of the options, modes, tactics, and commentary to keep both casual fans and soccer aficionados happy.
platforms: PS GG Gen PC 32X Saturn SNES GB
title: FIFA Soccer '96

description: The third installment of the MK series to grace the Nintendo 64 presents enough new features to astound even those well acquainted with previous MK entries. There are more fighters this time around, and you'll even get special characters from other games like Rain, Smoke, and Noob Saibot. The roster boasts a total of 26 available characters and four hidden ones that you can put to the test on 27 battlegrounds. As for the play control and moves, you can expect the countless bone-crunching Fatalities, Animalities, Babalities and Friendship Moves that you have come to love from past games. In addition, MORTAL KOMBAT TRILOGY features a new Aggressor Meter and Brutalities that let you pummel your rivals until they explode. You also have the chance to increase your score on Aggressor Moves and Kombos. Choose from two-on-two and three-on-three tag team options, as well as an Eight-Player Tournament mode.
platforms: N64 PS Saturn G.com PC RZone
rating_content: Realistic Blood, Realistic Blood and Gore, Realistic Violence
title: Mortal Kombat Trilogy

description: Two months after Super Mario 64 dazzled US gamers with its nearly flawless 3D platform gameplay, Nintendo unleashed what would become its best racing game for the N64. Developed by one of EAD's most talented teams, this masterpiece by legendary designer Shigeru Miyamoto showed that there was still plenty of room for growth in the crowded racing genre. Up to two players get behind the controls of Yamaha-licensed jet-skis and try to beat eight totally unique water courses. Add to that realistic sound effects and ground-breaking water effects and you've got an instant Nintendo water racing classic that will continue to serve as a reference for many future titles to come.
platforms: N64 iQ Wii Wii U Wii U
title: Wave Race 64

description: In the Toshinden Tournament anything goes. You will have to choose a character and battle for survival. All of the fights take place in 3D arenas that allow you complete freedom of movement. Attack your opponent from any direction to gain the advantage. Achieve victory by using your martial arts skills and carefully using special attacks and weapons. If you're successful, you'll discover hidden challengers. Fail, and you will pay the ultimate price. After you have decimated the computer-controlled challengers, you can take on your friends and discover the true master of BATTLE ARENA TOSHINDEN REMIX.
title: Battle Arena Toshinden Remix

description: CRUIS'N USA is Midway Games arcade hit from the mid-‘90s that ate up its share of quarters. At home on your Nintendo 64 you may miss the sticky arcade floors and the steering wheel, but once you hit the open road steering with the Nintendo 64's analog joystick, you'll leave your worries behind. Select your car from the four that are initially offered and get busy on your cross-country journey. Fourteen tracks will take you from one end of the United States to the other. However, since there are no conventional racetracks, there are no laps, and racing involves traveling from point A to point B as quickly as possible against up to eight computer players (or one human player). CRUIS'N USA offers the option for five difficulty levels, three views, automatic or manual transmission, and racing against oncoming traffic.
title: Cruis'n USA

description: Batman Forever: The Arcade Game follows the basic plot of the movie Batman Forever. The Riddler and Two-Face have hatched a plot to steal all of the deep, dark secrets of every citizen in Gotham, and the only people who can stop them are Batman and Robin. Take control of one of the Caped Crusaders and punch and kick your way through level after level thugs. Punching and kicking can be tiresome, so feel free to use any of a number of special weapons, including the Batarang. With all of the action, you'll want to strap on a utility belt and take out the villains yourself.
platforms: PS Arcade PC Saturn Pinball GB GG SNES RZone Gen
title: Batman Forever: The Arcade Game

description: Nintendo's joint effort with Paradigm Simulations (developers of military flight simulators) has yielded a game that offers a realistic training experience in aerial maneuvers: PILOTWINGS 64. As a student enrolled in a flight school, you receive training in various flight techniques, encountering challenges increasing in difficulty as the game progresses. The action unfolds in different U.S. locales, such as Mt. Rushmore, and farmlands complete with cornfields. Whether you are practicing parachuting or shrieking as you nose dive straight down from a high altitude, you will enjoy excellent game control thanks to Nintendo's analog joystick. The smooth and responsive control is one of the most attractive features of this game. The 3D graphics present a world of varying terrain and a true-to-life flying experience. Now you can try those daredevil stunts you have always dreamed of without having to worry about licenses or injury and see if your skills are good enough to avoid crashing and burning.
title: Pilotwings 64

description: You'd better come wearing your tough-guy boots if you hope to win this race. Extreme arcade racing has never been so rough, as you'll have to kick, beat, punch, and maul your opponents with chains, clubs, sticks, and other brutal weaponry. Of course, your opponents can and will fight back sometimes going so far as to put you on a hit list for later group pummeling. Not only that, you've got to watch out for the fuzz! The cops are out in full force setting up road blocks, chasing you on motorcycles, and hauling you off to jail if you're unfortunate enough to take a spill in front an officer. Pick your racer (the gamut runs from punks to jocks), and then head off to Der Panzer Klub where you can talk to fellow riders, sign up for a race, or purchase a new ride. You can choose between rat bikes, sport bikes, and super bikes, but you'll need to win plenty of races to earn enough cash for an upgrade. The five 3D tracks include the City, the Peninsula, Pacific Coast Highway, Sierra Nevada, and Napa Valley. Rev up for two-wheel brutality with ROAD RASH.
title: Road Rash

description: Get ready for the ride of your life as you strap in for a time-tested classic. The original high-octane racing challenge for the PlayStation, RIDGE RACER is based on a wildly successful arcade game. Bringing its signature graphics, realistic driving physics, and awesome soundtrack to you living room, RIDGE RACER has all of the excitement you'd expect from a coin-operated game and the detailed simulation of a PlayStation title. Choose from 13 different vehicles as you race your way to fame and glory. In lap after detailed lap, you'll have to do whatever's necessary to take the lead and defend your position. This is the game that introduced the now infamous "powerslide" move, a method of making turns without losing momentum. If the standard issue courses aren't enough for you, try reversing them! Each track has the capacity to be flipped, making for twice as much racing. The game is full of its share of surprises, including the opportunity to crash into a helicopter. Whether you're a racing fan or you're just looking for a seminal videogame title, you're sure to enjoy RIDGE RACER.
title: Ridge Racer [1995]

description: After being left to die in a botched attack, Da Wardenz want justice. You take the role of a rookie tank operator who wants to join them in their fight. To get in with Da Wardenz, you must battle your way through 25 missions, which will take you to exotic locations like Paraguay and Mostvia Vatska. Luckily, you are behind the controls of an M-13 Predator tank, and there are a wide array of weapons to use during each mission, including cannons, chain guns, and surface-to-air missiles. Between missions, you have an opportunity to upgrade the various parts of your tank like armor, chain-gun coolants, reload mechanisms, better targeting computers, traction, offensive air support, and engine upgrades. If you can impress the Da Wardenz, you will survive the action in SHELLSHOCK.
title: Shellshock

description: The popular PC series SimCity has come to the PlayStation with SimCity 2000. Take an empty plot of land and turn it into a thriving metropolis. Start by establishing power plants and setting up residential, commercial, and industrial zones. Once the town starts to grow, you'll need to provide an infrastructure water pipes, streets, and bridges. When your city gets large enough, you will have to deal with several public policy issues: where and when to build educational resources like schools, libraries, and universities? How can we halt crime? What kind of fire abatement policy is required? How are you going to pay for all of these programs? Real-world mayors and city councils face all of these issues on a daily basis, and now you have an opportunity to propose your solutions to these problems with SimCity 2000.
platforms: PS PC SNES Mac N64 PC GBA Saturn PC PS3 PSP
title: SimCity 2000

description: A return to the earliest days of the Street Fighter saga, Street Fighter Alpha brings together a cast of 13 characters, many of whom would come to be champions and challengers in later Street Fighter tournaments.  The series' inaugural title introduces super combos and alpha counters to add a new dimension to fighting.
platforms: PS Cell PSP PS3 Arcade PC Saturn GBC Cell
title: Street Fighter Alpha: Warriors' Dreams

description: Deep in the farthest reaches of outer space lies a menace of truly daunting proportions. You're the Galactic Federation agent charged with the task of figuring out just how to stop it, but that's not going to be easy the first step will be to infiltrate the Black Nexus to get inside the terror. With that accomplished, you'll finally find yourself face-to-face with the deadly hive that seems to be creating the toxins wreaking havoc on the universe at large. How you choose to proceed will make all of the difference in this massive gaming experience for sci-fi fans. Featuring a never-before-seen panoramic play technology, THE HIVE gives you a 360-degree range of motion opening up possibilities for extremely intense combat. You'll make your way through 18 enormous levels each more daunting than the last as you try to get to the other side of this epic adventure.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence
title: The Hive

description: You have been kidnapped by FUB (Fat Ugly Boy) and placed in a secret insane asylum. Now you must escape from the Asylum and get revenge in LOADED. You can play as six different demented characters, including an adult who still wears diapers and a cross-dressing lunatic with a shaved head and high heels. Each character has unique weapons and upgrades to use throughout the game eventually the weapons will have a blast larger than a character's entire body. The player will have to draw the enemies into firing range before letting them taste hot lead. A rock soundtrack, including tunes from Pop Will Eat Itself, enhances the action. Try to exact your revenge in LOADED, which is loaded with 15 levels of enemy blasting action.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence
title: Loaded

description: NBA LIVE ¿96 has a wide variety of options and features that make it a contender in the basketball world. You can play with all 29 NBA teams and over 300 NBA players, and every team's arena is faithfully reproduced. You'll also get multiple camera angles that give the game a TV-style presentation and help put you right in the game. Where the game truly shines when it comes to its play-calling system, which is very easy to use and very realistic. There are seven different offensive sets, each with 16 plays you can choose from, which makes it easy to keep your opponent on his toes at all times. If you get tired of thrashing computer opponents, the Versus mode lets you and a friend go head-to-head for hardwood bragging rights. NBA LIVE '96 is truly a pioneer in the basketball sim world.
title: NBA Live '96

description: Get ready to polish your detective skills in PSYCHIC DETECTIVE. In this game you are a psychic who makes a living as a detective. After getting caught up in a murder, you must use your psychic powers to solve the crime before more deaths occur. With over five hours of FMV for your viewing pleasure, PSYCHIC DETECTIVE is more like an interactive movie than a game, and gamers will spend plenty of time pointing-and-clicking through clues in order to solve the crime. You will have to carefully consider the evidence, interview prospective witnesses, and put all the pieces together. If you like detective stories, you will be definitely enjoy PSYCHIC DETECTIVE.
rating_content: Mature Sexual Themes, Realistic Blood, Strong Language
title: Psychic Detective

description: In NHL FACEOFF you'll find one-timers, a wide variety of checks, slap shots, drop passes, every NHL player and team, and plenty of statistics. The AI is top-notch, and the graphics are solid. The announcer is incredibly crisp and clear, and his voice reverberates with just the right amount of echo to give that in-the-arena feel. Combined with the organ music and cheering fans, the ambient sounds help put you in the stands, screaming your head off. And of course you can drop the gloves with all of the NHL's tough guys. There are even multiple camera angles that put you right in the middle of the action.
title: NHL FaceOff

description: This is the first installment in the NFL GAMEDAY series, and it has all the players, teams, stadiums, stats, and injuries that you see in the real NFL in fact, this game is so realistic it could even fool the most diehard fans into thinking they're watching a game on TV, not playing one. There is a wide variety of offensive and defensive moves you can use to make things easier, including dives, spins, hurdles, jukes, and stiff arms on offense; and dives, jumps, forearm bashes, and swim moves on defense. Basically, if you've seen it done in the real NFL, then chances are you'll see it in NFL GAMEDAY. Things like long snap counts, men in motion, and defensive stunts can all be found in the game, giving you an NFL experience like no other. You can also take on a friend in versus mode, and see who is the king of the gridiron.
title: NFL GameDay

description: As Captain Matt Coda you're responsible for ending the threat of the evil Dr. Kim. Fight your way through 15 foe-filled levels, each with increasing difficulty as the game progresses. Using an unparalled first-person perspective (from inside a mech warrior), Sony proudly presents Kileak   The DNA Imperative.
title: Kileak: The DNA Imperative

description: Psygnosis has recreated the world of racing with FORMULA 1 for the PlayStation. Choose from 35 different drivers and race on 17 real world tracks. When on the track, every driver has a personalized artificial intelligence: veterans handle the tracks better than rookies. Ultimately, all of the drivers race like their real-world counterparts. The two game modes, Arcade and Grand Prix, offer uniquely different experiences. The Arcade mode keeps the emphasis on driving fast and negotiating turns. Grand Prix offers more realistic racing action and has options to tune the car (including downforce, gearbox settings, and brake balance) for a specific track or driving style. Whether you like to drive as fast as possible on an empty track or you enjoy trying to jockey for position in a crowded tight turn, FORMULA 1 has the options to let you play the way you want to.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older
title: Formula 1

description: One of the strangest, most entertaining PC games ever, comes to the PlayStation. WORMS is a strategy game that pits up to four people against each other to see who will be the last one standing. Each player must collect weapons that vary from small guns to gigantic rocket launchers. The combat is turn-based, with each turn calling for the player to decide how and where to fire their weapon, and the trajectory at which it is to be fired. Players must also take the terrain into consideration, which features huge drops and trenches. While the action is not very fast-paced, it is highly entertaining, as each shot counts and misfires can lead to annihilation. There are a variety of levels to choose from that will challenge your strategic skills as well as your fortitude. WORMS is a great party game, yet the Single-Player mode is deep enough to make it a viable option in itself.
platforms: PS Mac Saturn Amiga SNES Gen C64 PC GB Cell Jaguar
title: Worms

description: ZOOP for the PlayStation is a puzzle game that introduces some new concepts to the puzzle genre. You must take control of a little tool that shoots out different colored blocks at blocks that litter the screen. If you can fire a block into another of the same color, they will disappear, thus helping to clear the area. Once every block is gone, the level is over. If you fire a block into another of a different color, it will pile up and you will have to shoot at it again. The graphics in puzzle games are never very complex, and this game is no exception. Every item is represented in a bright manner through sprites, so the gameplay and speed remain constant. There is a Two-Player mode present so that you can compete with a friend to see who can get the furthest in the game in the shortest amount of time. ZOOP is a classic, addictive puzzle game with a few new twists that help to separate it from similar titles.
platforms: PS Jaguar GG Mac Saturn GB Gen SNES PC
title: Zoop

description: The Iron Fist Tournament continues with TEKKEN 2. There are more than 20 characters to choose from, including some old favorites and a few new characters. As is required, all of the fighters have unique moves and combinations, and every fighter has at least three different 10-hit combinations. The motion-capture animation has returned, making all of the fighters move smoothly and realistically. If you're good enough to beat the Arcade mode, you are treated to a full-motion video clip that explains each character's motivation for entering the tournament. As you play through the game, you can unlock new modes like Tournament, Survival, and Practice. And challenging your friends to a match is no problem thanks to the Versus mode. Play TEKKEN 2 and become the king of the Iron Fist Tournament.
title: Tekken 2

description: Stat: Situation critical. Kreel unstoppable. International forces crushed. Deploy Warhawk, highly maneuverable, air-to-air, air-to-ground capable. Target: 6 hot zones: over 25 areas of high engagement: very hot. Objective: eliminate Kreel. This PlayStation launch game lets player man the deadly airship and attack in any direction. Maneuvers include reverse, sideways, stop and over, dive, barrel roll, loop and even the Immelman turn. Fire lock-ons, rockets, multi-fire swarmers, and plasma cannons and fight over desert wastelands, in castle hallways, a gothic tower, and more.
title: Warhawk

description: In IRON & BLOOD: Warriors of Ravenloft, you and your party are trying to pass through the realm of Ravenloft. However, you are caught in the conflict between Strahd von Zarovich and Lord Soth. In order to escape Ravenloft and continue on your way, you must fight the most malicious and evil monsters in all the land. Choose from any of the 16 playable characters including warriors, mages, elves, and other classes to lead the fight. With over 250 moves and combos, there is plenty ADVANCED DUNGEONS AND DRAGONS action.
title: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons: Iron & Blood -- Warriors of Ravenloft

description: Designer Shigeru Miyamoto's Mario sequel is considered by many to be one of the greatest videogames of all time. The title successfully proved that the famously polished, tried-and-true 2D play mechanics of the Super Mario Bros. series could be translated to 3D and, indeed, even in some cases improved upon. It also simultaneously helped define 3D gaming as a whole and pushed Nintendo's plumber mascot even further into the spotlight as one of the most recognizable figures in the games industry. Mario explores Princess Peach's castle and hunts for stars in a variety of differently themed stages. The platformer remains, even by today's harsh standards, a true masterpiece.
title: Super Mario 64

description: The Ultimate Puzzle Game in a Wacky World of Animals. You're the zookeeper in a crazy kingdom. But you'd better watch out -- once you dive into the Baku Baku den, there's no turning back. To win, match each animal with its favorite food. Challenge computer characters or go head-to-head in two-player mode. Beautiful 3D graphics and stunning color bring puzzling to the next level. Variable game speed lets you go slow-mo or full throttle. Better be clever: suprises await true Baku masters.
title: Baku Baku

description:
The living will have to survive amongst the dead in this game based on The Walking Dead, the widely acclaimed comic book series and television series. Across five dark and emotional episodes of gameplay, every decision and action you take can result in the entire story of the game changing around you.

The critically acclaimed debut episode of The Walking Dead begins at the outset of the undead apocalypse. Lee Everett awakes into a world collapsing into anarchy as society fails to deal with the undead plague. Seeking refuge, he stumbles upon Clementine, an eight year old girl whose parents are missing. Lee takes Clementine under his wing as they seek safety from the walkers all around them.
rating_content: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
title: The Walking Dead: The Game -- Episode 1: A New Day

description: Get on the podium with OLYMPIC SOCCER. All of the pomp and circumstance of the Games are here as you take the field against all the Olympic countries. Players can do back-heel passes, one-two plays, bicycle kicks, diving headers, and anything else you might see in a real Olympic soccer game. Beyond the traditional left-right spin, forward or reverse spin can also be put on the ball to further vary its trajectory. The game has the complete Olympic license, so all the countries are accurately represented, as well as the players. You can play a single game, a tournament, or Olympic modes, or you can take on a friend in the versus mode. If you think you have what it takes to compete against the best players on the pitch, you might able to take the coveted gold medal.
title: Olympic Soccer
